alert.note: Alert for Granite; Missoula; Powell (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued April 04 at 8:16PM MDT until April 04 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Missoula County in west central Montana... North central Granite County in west central Montana... West central Powell County in west central Montana... * Until 900 PM MDT. * At 816 PM MDT, a dangerous area of intense snow was located 15 miles east of Bonner-West Riverside, or 22 miles east of Missoula, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 112 and 131. Highway 83 between mile markers 0 and 2. Highway 200 between mile markers 4 and 52. Locations impacted include... Ovando, Garnet, Potomac, Clearwater, Greenough, Twin Creeks, Clinton and Turah. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
